org.kepler.profiling.gui

Class ExecutionMonitorPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.kepler.profiling.gui.ViewWatchingTabPane
              • org.kepler.profiling.gui.ExecutionMonitorPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, StateChangeListener, TabPane, ProvenanceEnabledListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CurrentExecutionPanel, PreviousExecutionPanel

    public abstract class ExecutionMonitorPanel
extends ViewWatchingTabPane
implements ProvenanceEnabledListener
    A panel that displays actor execution information. The execution information is driven by calling methods in the _executionMonitorRecording object. This class is abstract, and subclasses must instantiate _executionMonitorRecording and set its container to be the workflow to be monitored.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl
    See Also:
    Recording, Serialized Form

      A class to monitor workflow execution by receiving provenance events.
